name: sun
description: AG type main sequence star that provides heat, light, and energy to the solar system
revolution: N/A (The Sun is the center of the solar system, so it doesn't revolve around any celestial body)
rotation: Approximately 24.47 days at the equator, but it varies with latitude
composition: Primarily composed of hydrogen (about 74%) and helium (about 24%), with traces of other elements such as oxygen, carbon, and iron
atmosphere: The Sun has several layers, including the photosphere, chromosphere, and corona, with different temperatures and densities. It emits a continuous stream of charged particles called the solar wind.
surface_temp: 5,500°C at the surface and 15 million °C at the core
sun_dist: N/A (The Sun is the center of the solar system)
fun_facts: The Sun accounts for 99.86% of the mass in the solar system
Over one million Earths could fit inside the Sun
The Sun is almost a perfect sphere

name: mercury
description: Small, rocky planet closest to the Sun
composition: Mostly composed of iron and silicate rocks
atmosphere: Very thin and primarily consists of traces of helium, hydrogen, and oxygen
fun_facts: Mercury orbits so quickly around the Sun that people used to believed it was another star
Mercury is the second densest planet in the solar system
The orbit of Mercury played an important part in proving Albert Einstein’s theory of General Relativity

name: venus
description: Hot and hostile environment with a dense atmosphere
composition: Primarily composed of carbon dioxide with traces of nitrogen and sulfuric acid
atmosphere: Thick atmosphere mainly consisting of carbon dioxide with clouds of sulfuric acid
fun_facts: One day on Venus is longer than one year!
Venus rotate in the opposite direction to other planets
Venus is the closest planet to Earth

name: earth
description: Only known planet to support life
composition: Primarily composed of iron, oxygen, silicon, and magnesium, with a solid crust and molten inner core
atmosphere: Nitrogen (78%), oxygen (21%), with traces of other gases
fun_facts: Earth has one of the most circular orbits of all the eight planets
The abundance of oxygen on Earth comes from the plants of the planet rather than the atmosphere
Earth is the most dense planet in the solar system

name: mars
description: Cold, desertlike planet with evidence of liquid water in the past
composition: Primarily composed of iron, magnesium, silicon, and oxygen
atmosphere: Thin atmosphere mainly consisting of carbon dioxide with traces of nitrogen and argon
fun_facts: The tallest mountain known in the solar system is on Mars
Mars experiences huge dust storms which are the largest in our solar system
Mars does not have a magnetic field

name: the asteroid belt
description: The asteroid belt is a disk of asteroids located between the orbits of mars and Jupiter. It contains most of the known asteroids, having possibly millions or billions of asteroids. Most of them are as small as pebbles or dust particles, but there are some larger than 100 km.
types: C-type (carbonaceous), largely composed of carbon, making up 75% of the asteroid belt.
S-type (silicate/stony), mainly composed of iron and magnesium silicates, making up 17% of the asteroid belt.
M-type (metal-rich), composed of nickel and iron, making up 10% of the asteroid belt. There are also many other classes of asteroids which do not fit the 3 main classes.
composition: The asteroid belt contains various substances like iron, nickel, titanium, water, oxygen, etc. Asteroid mining is a prospective topic for future space advances. The asteroid belt has between 1,1 to 1,9 million asteroids larger than 1 km, and millions of smaller ones.
fun_facts: There is so much distance between asteroids (around 600,000 miles), it is easy for things to pass through the asteroid belt without hitting anything
The total mass of the asteroid belt is only about 4% that of the Earth’s Moon
The asteroid belt has one known dwarf planet, Ceres

name: jupiter
description: Largest planet in the solar system with distinct bands and a turbulent atmosphere
composition: Mostly composed of hydrogen and helium with traces of other compounds
atmosphere: Thick atmosphere consisting of hydrogen, helium, methane, ammonia, and other compounds
fun_facts: Jupiter has the shortest day of the eight planets
The largest of Jupiter’s moons, Ganymede is the largest moon in the solar system
Jupiter’s Great Red Spot is an enormous storm that has been raging for over 300 years

name: saturn
description: Known for its prominent ring system and numerous moons
composition: Mostly composed of hydrogen and helium with traces of other compounds
atmosphere: Thick atmosphere consisting of hydrogen, helium, methane, and other compounds
fun_facts: Saturn is one of five planets able to be seen with the naked eye. It is also the fifth brightest object in the solar system
Saturn gives off more energy than it receives from the Sun
Saturn is the least dense planet in the solar system

name: uranus
description: Bluegreen color due to methane in its atmosphere and rotates on its side
composition: Mostly composed of hydrogen and helium with traces of methane
atmosphere: Thin atmosphere mainly consisting of hydrogen, helium, and methane
fun_facts: Uranus is often referred to as the “ice giant”
Uranus is the second least dense planet in the solar system
Uranus has 13 currently known rings

name: neptune
description: Known for its deep blue color and strong winds
composition: Mostly composed of hydrogen and helium with traces of methane
atmosphere: Thick atmosphere consisting of hydrogen, helium, and methane
fun_facts: Despite being one of the biggest planets, it has a very quick rotation period of just 16,11 earth hours
It takes sunlight almost 4 hours 40 minutes to reach Neptune
Neptune has giant storms like Jupiter, however the storms don’t last as long. Neptune has the fastest winds in the solar system
